79.title: How Is Your Microphone Cable?
79.plot: Preparing for CES, Gordon dunks a radio in water, and how to reduce RF interference. Guests: Don Wilbanks (AE5DW), and Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK)

80.title: Interest Your Wife in Ham Radio
80.plot: Photos from Hamfest, hands-on with the new Icom IC-7100, and getting your wife into Ham radio. Guests: Amanda Alden (K1DDN) and Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK)

81.title: The History of Single Sideband
81.plot: History of single sideband, phasing with 2 mics, Julian Frost's video segment - Ham radio gear at CES 2013, and more. Guests: George Maier (W1LSB), and Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK)

82.title: The Softrock Payoff
82.plot: 'Show Us Your Shack' photos, Julian Frost's video segment - Fox Hunting, and the Softrock RXTX Ensemble finale. Guests: Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK).

83.title: Where in the World is Gordo?
83.plot: Julian Frost's video segment - Quartzfest 2013, and a close look at PL259 UHF connectors and a hamfest report from George Thomas. Guests: Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK).

84.title: Hams Attend NAMM
84.plot: The NAMM show, Julian Frost's video segment - a preview of the Winter 2013 edition of CQ VHF, cheap wire tricks from George, and more. Guests: Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK).

85.title: It's Valentine's Day!
85.plot: The InnovAntenna, Bob's custom built gear, Julian Frost's video segment - K7RJ 10GHz Beacon, and how to build a class-D amplifier. Guests: Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK).

86.title: A Tribute to Wes Schum
86.plot: Hands-on with the TS-990, a tribute to Wes Schum, and a homemade outpost. Guests: Don Wilbanks (AE5DW), Nick Tusa (K5EF), George Maier (W1LSB), and Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK).

87.title: Show Us Your Shack
87.plot: A look at ham shacks across the country, snow on antennas, and all about how inductors work. Guests: Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK).

88.title: Ham Radio Featured on Tim Allen's Last Man Standing
88.plot: Julian Frost shows his behind the scenes look at the ham radio gear used on the set of Tim Allen's Last Man Standing, and interviews the show's producer, John Amodeo. Guests: John Amodeo (NN6JA) and Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK).

89.title: George Receives Dayton's Special Achievement Award
89.plot: Hamvention award winners, contesting with vintage gear, and how to use a transistor relay driver. Guests: Michael Kalter (W8CI), Amanda Alden (K1DDN)

90.title: We Visit GigaParts
90.plot: Bob shows off the Yaesu FT 3000, Ham Radio Day at GigaParts, and a look at transformers.

91.title: George Builds an AM/FM Radio Kit
91.plot: Boy Scouts ham radio merit badge, video from IWCE, and George builds an AM/FM radio kit. Guest: Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK)

92.title: AES SuperFest and Smoke&Solder
92.plot: Bob's on the road, Gordo demonstrates interference, Julian Frost's video segment, and part two of building an AM/FM radio. Guest: Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK)

93.title: Viewer Discretion Aadvised
93.plot: The FCC's possible elimination of indecency policies, Bob checks in live from NAB, and Julian Frost's Video segment. Guests: Bob Heil (K9EID) and Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK)

94.title: Tim and Ray at TWiT
94.plot: Dayton Hamvention 2013, part four of building an AM/FM radio, and your ham questions answered. Guests: Tim Duffy (K3LR), Ray Novak (N9JA), Don Wilbanks (AE5DW), and Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK).

95.title: I'm Back!
95.plot: Bob is back with video of Joe Walsh and Bob Seger, help needed at Dayton, Newsline update about Boston, Julian Frost's video segment, and more. Guest: Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK).

96.title: Congratulations to Jay Adrick for the NAB Award
96.plot: We talk with NAB award winner Jay Adkins, video from George's celebration dinner, and creating parts with Shapelock. Guests: Jay Adrick (K8CJY) and Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK).

22.title: Boy Scouts on the Air
22.plot: Bob's trip to the National UK Hamfest and Lincoln Cathedral, 54th JOTA 2011, and a solder fumes extractor. Guests: Doug Cook (KD5PDN) and Carey McCachern (KF5IXE)

23.title: Leo Works the Pile-Up
23.plot: Indoor antennas, etching your own PC board, transmitting remotely from 3000 miles away, and more. N4PY Software provides the software for the Remote Mirrored Radio setup.

24.title: Youth Month
24.plot: Amateur TV, W0EEE back on the air, and the kick off of Ham Nation Youth Month.

25.title: Youth Month
25.plot: 98 new hams from Cal Poly, Dave Kalter and Don Dubon talk about their Youth DX Adventure, rub-on transfers for PC boards, and more. Guests: Dave Kalter (KB8OCP), Don Dubon (N6JRL), Dave Kalter (KB8OCP), Mitchell (KD8JRS), Rachel (KD8FOB), and Arthur (KD8NUB).

26.title: The Kids from Greenville Worth the Space Station
26.plot: Greenville Elementary students talk to the ISS, fox-hunting, building and testing an audio generator, and more. Guests: John King (W9KXQ), Jim (KF4NBG), Ken Norris (KK9N), and Tom Merritt from TWiT.TV

27.title: The Kids Are All Right
27.plot: The end of youth month, ARRL's video contest, building an electronic temperature sensor, and more. Guests: Duncan (KU0DM), Elijah (WA6EMD), Daniel (KI6TNE), and Spencer (NG6K)

28.title: It's Couples Month
28.plot: Julian Frost's video of Wayne (W6IRD) and Sharon (K6IRD) Spring showing off their shack and workshop, manufacturer's day at the Atlanta Ham Radio Outlet, surface mount soldering, and more.

29.title: It's Couple Month
29.plot: Julian Frost's video of Dan (N6PEQ) and Kristin (K6PEQ) Dankert's super shack, need another connection to your 12v power supply, Happy Holiday wishes, and more. Guest: Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK)

30.title: DIY Magic of Amateur Radio
30.plot: DIY hams, noise limiting, Julian Frost's video of the D-STAR QSO Party contest winners, chat Q&A, and more. Guest: Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK)

31.title: Ham Nation at CES
31.plot: US Supreme Court looking at the FCC, building a voice recorder, and more.

32.title: CES Part II
32.plot: Tim Allen's shack, second part of Julian's video from CES, ICOM 718 and 7200 reviews, and more.

33.title: Leo and the Blazing Pickle
33.plot: Gordo talks about his adventures at Quartzfest, inspiration from Peggy Sue (K5PSG). Leo smokes a pickle, and more. Guest: Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK).

34.title: John Amodeo, Producer of Last Man Standing
34.plot: John Amodeo, producer of ABC's new show, Last Man Standing, talks about the show, Tim Allen, and ham radio, Gordo reports from his annual CERT class, installing a mic connector, and more.

35.title: Amanda and Jeff Join Us on Valentines Day
35.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

36.title: Connect an Audio Mixer to Your Transmitter
36.plot: Ham Tails with Amanda Alden, Julian Frost builds a Homopolar Motor, Bob Heil talks about Audio Mixers.

37.title: The Orlando HamCation
37.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

38.title: The Dayton Hamvention Announces Their Awards
38.plot: Dayton Hamvention 2012 plans, the history of qrz.com, building a Dremel table saw, and more. Guests: Michael Kalter (W8CI), Fred Lloyd (AA7BQ), Amanda Alden (K1DDN), and Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK)

39.title: Meet Jacob, the 14-year Old Wiz Kid
39.plot: A chat with a young ham, a report from a near-space balloon launch, building your own breakout box, TV Studio sneak peak, and more. Guests: Jacob Keogh (KD0NVX), Amanda Alden (K1DDN), and Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK)

40.title: From the Last Man Standing Set
40.plot: Ham Nation at the Last Man Standing stage, a demo and world tour of the WIN System, building a custom box for your home-made devices, and more. Guests: Jeff "Shorty" Stouffer (K6JSI), Ray Novak (N9JA), Marty Woll, Amanda Alden (K1DDN)

41.title: Tour Audio Power Labs
41.plot: We take a tour of Audio Power Labs a company born of a desire to create products that provide the ultimate listening experience for audiophiles, and more. Guests: Gerry Moersdorf (KC8ZUL), Amanda Alden (K1DDN)

42.title: A Visit with Rebecca, KB0VVT
42.plot: A 330A tube-powered audio amplifier, a visit to M2 Antenna Systems' open house, a unique antenna rotor system, and more. Guests: Gerry Moersdorf (KC8ZUL), Rebecca Rich (KB0VVT), Amanda Alden (K1DDN), and Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK)

43.title: Steve, WB2WIK, All Things Ham Radio
43.plot: We talk to Steve Katz about all things HAM radio, free schematic CAD software, NAB next week, and more. Guests: Steve Katz (WB2WIK), Don Wiltsanks (AE5DW), Amanda Alden (K1DDN), and Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK)

44.title: Hams at NAB 2012
44.plot: The Ham Nation invades NAB Show 2012 in Las Vegas, and does the show live from the NAB show floor. Guests: Kirk Harnack (KD5FYD), Tim Schwieger and Charles Wooten

45.title: Joe Rudi Trades His Baseball Glove for a Morse Code Key
45.plot: Former MLB player Joe Rudi tells his ham story, Bob visits the Southwest Missouri Amateur Radio Club, free CAD software for designing PC boards, and more. Guests: Joe Rudi (NK7U), Amanda Alden (K1DDN), and Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK)

46.title: Contest University at the Dayton Hamvention
46.plot: Kids talk to the ISS, an educational hamfest, transferring a CAD drawing to a PC board with toner, and more. Guests: Clint Bradford (K6LCS), Tim Duffy (K3LR)

47.title: W5KUB and Michael Kalter
47.plot: Tom Medlin (W5KUB) tells us about W5KUB.com, Michael Kalter (W8CI) talks to us about Dayton Hamvention, and more. Guests: Tom Medlin (W5KUB), Don Arnold (W6GPS), Michael Kalter (W8CI)

48.title: Solder, Shacks and Dayton. Oh My!

49.title: The Dayton Experience
49.plot: The hosts return from Dayton Hamvention with all sorts of goodies, including part 1 of the Dayton Video by Julian Frost, and it's Ham Nations one year birthday! Guests: Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK), Don Wilbanks (AE5DW), and Ray and Cindy Novack.

50.title: Gordo and Julian Fro Hawaii
50.plot: Julian Frost gets married in Hawaii! Transmitting from the beach, part 2 of the Dayton Video by Julian Frost, HF receiver operation, and more. Guests: Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK), Don Wilbanks (AE5DW)

51.title: Amanda Returns
51.plot: Hawaiian hams, bringing the coax in, Smoke and Solder classic, and more. Guests Amanda Alden (K1DDN), and Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK)

52.title: Outside, Kids, It's Field Day!
52.plot: Bob at the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame, Colorado fires update, building an Elecraft kit, Ham radio on the beach in Hawaii, Julian Frost's wedding. Guests Amanda Alden (K1DDN), and Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK)

53.title: The Night Before Field Day
53.plot: Stringing an antenna with a potato gun, coiling coax, resistors & Ohm's law, and more. Guests Amanda Alden (K1DDN), and Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK)

54.title: It's Field Day Coverage
54.plot: Bob's Rock Hall and field day reports, field day tips, properly connecting a PL-259 plug, Julian Frost's video segment, and more. Guests Don Wilbanks (AE5DW) and Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK).

55.title: George's New Studio
55.plot: Anacapa high altitude balloon probe, Bob's new antenna farm, constructing George's new shack studio, Julian Frost's video segment, and more. Guests Amanda Alden (K1DDN), and Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK).

56.title: Mobile HF Antennas
56.plot: Going HF mobile with Gordon West and Julian Frost, Gonset Communicator restoration, Raspberry Pi, and more.

57.title: Tom, HQARadio
57.plot: Tom Samacico talks about HQARadio, Julian Frost's video segment includes a report from Maker Faire, grounding your station, and more.

58.title: Lonnie, W0GZV Talks About Fi-Fi
58.plot: Learn about the B-29 bomber Fi-Fi, Julian Frost's video segment includes a report on Quantum Sphere batteries, grounding revisited, and more.

59.title: Meet the Net Control Operators
59.plot: How Bill (K5LN) keeps the Nets goin', capacitors explained, Julian Frost's video segment - 10Ghz antenna testing, and more. Guests: Don Wilbanks (AE5DW), Ray Novack and Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK).

60.title: Chatrooms and Contests
60.plot: Amanda returns, back to school with Gordon, capacitive reactance, and more. Guests Amanda Alden (K1DDN), and Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK)

61.title: The Huntsville Hamfest
61.plot: The controller of the 40-meter after-show nets, the latest from the Huntsville Hamfest, upcoming kit builds, and more. Guests: Mike Ferreira (WT6H) and Don Wilbanks (AE5DW)

62.title: Hurricane Party
62.plot: Hurricane season is among us and we're keeping an eye on this windy party. Julian Frost interviews Heather Glass (K6HEY) in the eye of the hurricane. Guests: Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK), Amanda Alden K1DDN and Don Wilbanks (AE5DW)

63.title: After Isaac and the Icom COntest
63.plot: Bob's phased 75 meter dipoles, video of hurricane Isaac, George starts building a shortwave radio, and the Icom contest. Guests: Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK), Ray Novak (N9JA)

64.title: Bull
64.plot: Winners were selected in the Icom contest, George finishes building a shortwave radio, and "heads-up" mobile installations. Guests: Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK), Clayton Cullen (W6CEC), Don Wilbanks (AE5DW), and Ray Novak (N9JA)

65.title: The Science of the Phased Array
65.plot: Phased array explained, Bob narrates PBR, build at home Open Beacon, and more. Guests: Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK), and Don Wilbanks (AE5DW)

66.title: Great Videos from You, the Viewers
66.plot: Capacitor and resistor substitution boxes, remote Ham radio operation, and Julian Frost's video segment has videos from viewers. Guests: Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK), Don Wilbanks (AE5DW)

67.title: Big Doin's in Starkville
67.plot: The MFJ 40th anniversary, identifying broadband noise, building an OpenBeacon, Julian Frost's video segment, and more. Guests: Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK)

68.title: George Enjoys MFJ's 40th Anniversary
68.plot: Bob's birthday, MFJ anniversary, and VHF APRS mobile on a rental car. Guests: Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK), Don Wilbanks (AE5DW)

69.title: On the Road Again with Gordo and Don
69.plot: We go on the road with Gordo and Don! Julian Frost's video segment: an Introduction to Icom's DSP. Guests: Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK), Don Wilbanks (AE5DW),

70.title: The CQ World Wide DX Contest
70.plot: The CQ World Wide contest this weekend, obtaining a commercial radio telephone license, Julian Frost's video segment, and more. Guests: Don Wilbanks (AE5DW)

71.title: Hams on Halloween
71.plot: Impact of Hurricane Sandy, Julian Frost's video from the K6H PAPA System Special Event at the Last Man Standing TV studio, and the hams get in costume. Guests: Tom Samacicio (KB4HQA), and Bill Sepulveda (K5LN).

72.title: Bob's Organ Transplant
72.plot: The importance of ham radio in natural disasters, and Bob plays his recently relocated organ. Guests: Al Mathews (K1LTJ) and Don Wilbanks (AE5DW).

73.title: CW Sweepstakes Weekend
73.plot: A look back at Ham newsletters, Bob's tower project, and tracing coax cable with a cassette player. Guests: Don Wilbanks (AE5DW), and Dan Vanevenhoven (N8LVS).

74.title: Tower Safety and Coaxial Dipoles
74.plot: More about coaxial dipole antennas, tower safety do's and don'ts, and Bob plays the organ for Julian's birthday. Guests: Don Wilbanks (AE5DW), Amanda Alden (K1DDN), and Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK).

75.title: Our 75th Anniversary
75.plot: Leo joins us for our 75th anniversary, Bob fires up an original 1956 Harvey-Wells, and more. Guests: Leo Laporte (W6TWT), Don Wilbanks (AE5DW), and Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK).

76.title: Gordon Receives the RCA Award
76.plot: Gordon receives an RCA award, setting up an APRS iGate, Bob's switch panel, Julian Frost's video segment, and more. Guests: Don Wilbanks (AE5DW), and Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK).

77.title: Cheryl's Ham Nation Anniversary
77.plot: Bob takes a tour of Voice of America, the Quartzfest Ham radio gathering, and more. Guests: Don Wilbanks (AE5DW) and Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK).

78.title: Merry Christmas from Ham Nation!
78.plot: HRO Appreciation Day in Atlanta, Christmas poems, and turning a Raspberry Pi into an FM transmitter, Julian Frost's video segment. Guests: Don Wilbanks (AE5DW), Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK), and Amanda Alden (K1DDN).

imdb.title: Ham Nation
synopsis: Bob Heil (K9EID), Gordon West (WB6NOA), George Thomas (W5JDX) and a regular bunch co-hosts, including Julian Frost (N3JF), Don Wilbanks (AE5DW) and Cheryl Lasek (K9BIK), discuss everything Ham radio related.Previous episodes have shown the history of SSB, Amateur Television, 10GHz Antenna Tests, Mobile HF Antennas, Icom HF DSP, contacts with the International Space Station, Field Day reports, Special Events, trips to television studios, tips and tricks, and even a ham wedding!Packed with videos, photos and guest speakers, each Ham Nation is a must-see show for every amateur radio operator.Watch the show as it's recorded live, every Wednesday at 7pm (Pacific) and join in the chatroom on IRC channel #twitlive. All the earlier episodes are available on-line on YouTube and iTunes, as well as on the TWiT web site.
